articles.title: South Africa legend Herschelle Gibbs gearing up to meet Kannada superstar Kiccha Sudeep in India; actor confirms re-union
articles.description: Herschelle Gibbs took to social media to inform about visiting India and meeting Kannada superstar Kiccha Sudeep. Kiccha responded to Gibbs' message and confirmed the news.
articles.content: Former South Africa cricketer Herschelle Gibbs has recently set the cricket and cinema world abuzz with the exciting news of his upcoming visit to India. The reason behind the buzz is Gibbs’ social media post that he shared to inform about him gearin... [2361 chars]

articles.title: India says new IT fact-checking unit will not censor journalism
articles.description: A proposed Indian government unit to fact-check news on social media is not about censoring journalism nor will it have any impact on media reportage, a federal minister said on Friday.
articles.content:
NEW DELHI, April 14 (Reuters) - A proposed Indian government unit to fact-check news on social media is not about censoring journalism nor will it have any impact on media reportage, a federal minister said on Friday.
Recently amended IT regulation r... [688 chars]

articles.title: Indian editors decry government move to police online news
articles.description: The Editors Guild of India is deeply disturbed by the government's move to police news on social media through a self-appointed fact-checking unit, the industry body said on Friday, describing the new rules as draconian and akin to censorship.
articles.content:

articles.title: India editors warn 'fake news' proposal akin to censorship
articles.description: A major Indian journalist group urged the government to reject a proposal to police fake news on social media, saying such a change to the country's information-technology rules would be akin to censorship.
articles.content:
NEW DELHI, Jan 19 (Reuters) - A major Indian journalist group urged the government to reject a proposal to police fake news on social media, saying such a change to the country's information-technology rules would be akin to censorship.
The proposal ... [1238 chars]

articles.title: India considers banning news identified as 'fake' by govt on social media
articles.description: India's government will not permit social media platforms to host any information that it identifies as false, according to a draft proposal of the country's IT rules released this week.
articles.content:
NEW DELHI, Jan 18 (Reuters) - India's government will not permit social media platforms to host any information that it identifies as false, according to a draft proposal of the country's IT rules released this week.
This is the latest in a slew of m... [1227 chars]

articles.title: India’s Inshorts raises $60 million following Public social network app growth
articles.description: Indian startup Inshorts, which operates an eponymous news aggregator service, has raised $60 million in a new financing round as its two-year-old bet — launch of a new social media app called Public — continues to impress, the startup confirmed to TechCrunch on Thursday. Vy Capital led the new round in Inshorts, which has raised […]

articles.title: Twitter needs India and Nigeria to grow. It's running into trouble in both
articles.description: The news social media rules in India and the ban in Nigeria are challenging for Twitter, considering how sizable its growth opportunities are in both markets.
articles.content:
New Delhi (CNN Business) Twitter is under siege in two countries that are critical for its global growth plans.

articles.title: Sachin Tendulkar tests positive for novel coronavirus; goes into self-quarantine
articles.description: Batting legend Sachin Tendulkar has been tested positive for the novel coronavirus. The former India skipper took to social media to confirm the news. The Mumbaikar said that he is currently in home isolation. Tendulkar made it clear that the…
